snippet: The Kremlin’s double game in Ukraine — publicly endorsing peace talks while secretly supporting the separatists — appeared less crafty than disastrous after the downing of a Malaysian jet.
abstract: Spotlight is focused on Moscow following crash of civilian jetliner Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 in Ukraine; Russia has denied equipping separatists in Ukraine with men or weapons but crash raises new questions about the involvement of Russian security services; only someone with military training would have been able to operate technically complicated air defense system need to fire missile to such height.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and ANDREW E. KRAMER

lead_paragraph: The Kremlin’s double game in Ukraine — publicly endorsing peace talks while secretly supporting the separatists — appeared less crafty than disastrous after the downing of a Malaysian jet.

headline.main: Air Disaster Strains Moscow’s Competing Strategy on Ukrainian Rebels
headline.print_headline: Air Disaster Strains Moscow’s Competing Strategy on Ukrainian Rebels
